alert.note: Alert for Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued April 10 at 2:38AM PDT until April 12 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. For the High Wind Watch, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible. * WHERE...Santa Clarita Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 9 AM PDT this morning. For the High Wind Watch, from Monday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down large objects such as trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel could be difficult, especially for drivers of high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
